section.title: Present simple: he and she (positive form)
section.sectiontitle: We add an -s to most verbs in the he/she form of the Present simple.
section.sectiontitle2: We add -es to verbs ending in -ch, -sh, -o, -s, -x or -z.
section.text3a: Jean watches TV. Ana goes shopping a lot.

section.title: Present simple: he and she (positive form)
section.sectiontitle: Verbs ending in a consonant (b, r, l etc.) + -y, we change the -y to -ies.
section.sectiontitle2: Some verbs are irregular. There are no rules for irregular verbs!

section.title: Present simple: he and she (negative form)
section.sectiontitle: In the negative, we use he/she does not + verb. We usually use the short form: he/she doesn't + verb.
section.text2a: Emma doesn't use the Internet at work.

section.title: Present simple: he and she (question forms)
section.sectiontitle: In the question form, we use does + subject + verb. The short answer is Yes, he/she does or No, he/she doesn't.
section.text1a: Does she eat Italian food? Yes, she does.
section.text2a: Does he live in the town? No, he doesn't.
